Case reference: 2006010799.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1979, Keith Cromwell was last seen as he departed from Quarry Island/Lake of the Woods, near Kenora, Ontario, in a motor boat. Keith never arrived at his destination, Fog Island.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014004122.CaseDesc: Maria Evangelista was last seen on January 27, 1997, in Montreal. Maria had called her mother to tell her that she no longer wanted to return to the hospital and would like to work in California. Maria's luggage was found in a hotel, in San Francisco, on February 7, 1997.

Case reference: 2008002899.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1998 Melvin Spence, an offshore laborer, left the farm he was employed at and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001638.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1977, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Norman Louison was last seen walking to a residence on the Cowessess First Nation near Broadview, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2006026699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1967, at about 10:30 a.m. Mr. Sauder was fishing with friends in Bouillon Lake, Calvin Township, District of Nipissing, in a twelve foot aluminum boat. He stood up and the boat capsized. Mr. Sauder could not swim and was not wearing a life jacket.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005536.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 25, 1996, Renée Simard was seen for the last time as she left her family home in Matane, Quebec. Renée had indicated that she was going for a walk, and at approximately 2:30 p.m. she was seen near the wharf along the Matane River at the mouth of the St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2013000134.CaseDesc: Loretta (Lora) Ann Frank was last seen in Yukon Territory between late 1988 and early 1989. She was known to reside in Watson Lake and Whitehorse, Yukon as well as Lower Post, British Columbia. Loretta was reported missing in 1993. Loretta is known to have a history of mental health concerns.

Case reference: 2006008499.CaseDesc: Anthony Huss was last seen November 08, 1975 leaving the Bon Aire Motel. He indicated that he was travelling to Chapleau. His vehicle was located, abandoned in a bush area near Smokey Falls, Kipling Township, District of Cochrane. Mr. Huss has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019058725.CaseDesc: In the spring of 2019, Glenn Field was seen for the last time by a pilot flying over his campsite located at Rolfe Lake, Northwest Territories. Glenn had flown out to Rolfe Lake in September of 2018 with the intentions of spending the winter living on the land and making his way back to Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, in the Spring of 2019. Glenn had three dogs with him and food to last the winter. The RCMP Search and Rescue conducted an areal search of Rolfe Lake in October of 2019, but found no signs of Glenn.

Case reference: 2018035793.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2018, Desmond Fischer was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go for a walk in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Desmond is known for following a very strict routine, and his disappearance is out of character.

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2014004563.CaseDesc: Brian Nadeau and David Pushor were last seen on November 25, 2004 travelling together in a 1983 Honda Civic near Fort Assiniboine, Alberta. The vehicle was later recovered from the Athabasca river where Highway 661 crosses via an ice bridge in the winter. Mr. Nadeau and Mr. Pushor were not located.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Text "Love is kind, 69er, Devil"

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000138.CaseDesc: Peter Limberis was last seen in Trail BC on July 20, 2005. He left Trail on his way to Saskatchewan, driving in his white 2003 Saturn Vue with Saskatchewan licence plate 850ENA. Mr. Limberis was also travelling with his dog, a white and brown smooth haired Fox Terrier named Pedro.

Chain: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, chain
Pants: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Track
Shirt: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Jersey
Watch: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Jail house noose

Case reference: 2020015970.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2017, John Spratt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John is known to be homeless, and has been diagnosed with some serious health issues. John would always check in with his family every couple of years, however, they have not heard from him since 2017.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Louis left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Jean-Louis was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014002176.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1997, Michelle McGillion was seen for the last time in Fort McMurray, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Michelle was living a high-risk lifestyle and may have been despondent. She has ties to Alberta, Yukon, and Ontario where her family resides.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014002895.CaseDesc: Pierre Merasty grew up in the Lynn Lake area of MB and resided there until November of 1994 when he moved to Winnipeg, MB.  He lived with family and friends for a while prior to moving into a house in the downtown area of Winnipeg.  After he moved, he was never heard from again.  Mr. Merasty was known to frequent the Main Street bars and would usually walk anywhere he had to go.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2014004399.CaseDesc: On November 23rd, 2003 Donna Bakker was last observed leaving her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. The following day, her vehicle was located abandoned in Niagara Falls, New York.  Donna's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005093.CaseDesc: Hooshang Imanpoorsaid was last seen on May 2, 2008. At that time, he was living in Brossard. He was reported missing by his family. Mr. Imanpoorsaid’s credit card was used at Dorval airport and the Netherlands in 2008. He is of Iranian descent.

Case reference: 2022054292.CaseDesc: Steven Blanchette Rochefort was reported missing on October 26, 2022. The last footprint of life for Steven Blanchette Rochefort was on July 11, 2022, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020650.CaseDesc: On February 11, 2007, Danita Bigeagle was seen for the last time near the 800 block of Victoria Avenue in Regina, Saskatchewan. Danita is known to frequent the city’s downtown area, and she rarely leaves Regina.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Quilted parka with drawstring waist
Tattoo: Left Hand, Happy face and the letter "d" on the web of her left hand

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2012020009.CaseDesc: Kathleen Wattley was last seen on June 13, 1992. It is unusual for Kathleen not to return home to her children. Kathleen was known to live a high risk life style.

Case reference: 2021022554.CaseDesc: Muoi Nguyen was last seen on January 5, 1990 and was reported missing on January 12, 1990. Police have not been able to locate Muoi NGUYEN.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2012020099.CaseDesc: Jack (Mike) St. Pierre was last seen on July 17, 2009, at approximately 1:00 p.m. He was on foot southbound from "the point" toward the hamlet of Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. Jack may have been seen later taking a boat across the Bay at Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. Articles of clothing were located in the water near where he was last thought to have been seen.

Case reference: 2014004567.CaseDesc: Marten Wenzel was last heard from by his family in August of 2004. Marten was known to contact his family at least once a month. During the time of his disappearance, Marten was living in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006020299.CaseDesc: Mary Ann Copeman was last seen on September 5, 1993 when she left to go on a recreational walk. Ms. Copeman was known to have mental health issues and may have been in a confused state. She was walking in the vicinity of Fifth Street in Balmertown, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2014004607.CaseDesc: George Robichaud was last seen by his roommate on March 15, 2005, at their home in Moncton, New Brunswick. George was suffering from mental health issues at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2023005537.CaseDesc: Robey BAPTISTE was last seen on January 26, 2023, in Edmonton, Alberta.  Robey left his residence with a backpack containing some personal items.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2012020075.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1974, Annie Yassie was seen for the last time by a taxi driver in Churchill, Manitoba. At that time, Annie was accompanied by a male friend.

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2023043268.CaseDesc: Cavan Usher was last seen on the morning of June 22,2023 in the vicinity of Charlton Avenue East and James Street South, in Hamilton, Ontario. Despite Cavan leading a transient lifestyle, this is the longest period of time without any contact, either through social media or other means.

Case reference: 2014002222.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1958, at approximately 9:15 a.m., Cindy-Lou McLane was last seen playing outside of her residence in Willow River, British Columbia. There is a strong possibility that Cindy-Lou may have been abducted.

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2019056482.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 26, 2019, Gregory Paul Agnew was seen for the last time in his green Pontiac Sunfire, leaving a mushroom picker’s camp located at the 11km mark on the Kinsckutch Forest Service Road in New Aiyansh, to run errands in Terrace, British Columbia. On the evening of September 27, 2019, the Pontiac Sunfire was observed at his campsite along with his camper van, but Gregory was not there. An extensive search of the area was conducted with no success. Gregory has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016047824.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2016, Marie-Claude Hebert was last seen leaving her residence, on foot, on St-Calixte Street in Plessisville, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Sweater: Cotton, Black, Unknown logo on the front

Case reference: 2014002689.CaseDesc: Karel Szabo was last heard from in April or May of 1985, when he sent his mother, who lived in Czechoslovakia, a postcard from Los Angeles, California. Karel had written about his travels to Las Vegas and San Francisco. In November 1984, Karel had informed his family that he was going to Barrie, Ontario, to get a trucking job; when in fact he travelled to the United States.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Jaw, Lower right side jaw broken in 1982.
Scar: Waist, Dime sized surgical scar near the bellybutton.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2006021699.CaseDesc: Karl Anderson was last seen on September 3, 1974 in Upsala, Ontario. It was thought that he possibly travelled by train to Sioux Lookout or Thunder Bay to seek medical treatment.

Case reference: 2006010099.CaseDesc: David Stevens was last seen June 14, 1979, in a canoe on the Ogoki River, approximately 70 km north of Armstrong. He was believed to be going towards Whitewater Lake. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. Stevens.

Case reference: 2014003002.CaseDesc: Roger Paul Bertrand left his residence on November 11, 1999, between the hours of 10:00 and 11:30 am. He appeared nervous a week prior to his disappearance due to an upcoming commitment. He was on a disability pension and suffered from back and leg problems which required a brace and a cane to walk.  He left behind his brace and cane at his residence. It appears that Mr. Bertrand may have been a victim of foul play.

Jacket: Leather, Black, With buckles and zippers
Tattoo: Left Hand, Raccoon between the thumb and finger.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2022014122.CaseDesc: On the night of April 5, 2022, Remesie Uy was seen for the last time at her home in Calgary, Alberta.  She is thought to have traveled to the Edmonton, Alberta area. Remesie has not been seen or heard from since.

Pierce: Ears, 2-3 Earrings in one ear.  Unknown which ear.

Case reference: 2013000093.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1989, Arlene Gagne was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Arlene told her husband that she wanted to stay home for the day. When her husband came back, Arlene was not home. All of her personal belongings were left at home.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014005836.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2012, at approximately 3:30 P.M., Warfa Yusuf was seen for the last time in the area of Rossland Road and Harwood Avenue, in the Town of Ajax, Ontario. Warfa was observed entering a vehicle and was never seen or heard from since.

Mark: Left Ear, Birthmark behind left ear

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2015005930.CaseDesc: On January 31st, 2015 Ali Jamil was seen for the last time in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, Ali was despondent.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2006018099.CaseDesc: On January 4, 1994, David Ernest Rowbotham was last seen in the Belleville/Trenton Ontario area.

Case reference: 2014001469.CaseDesc: On November 28,1988, Douglas Babineau was seen for the last time at a party located on First Avenue in Moncton, New Brunswick. Douglas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006199.CaseDesc: Albert RIDDY went missing from his residence between April 5 and July 30, 2013. He has not been located since. The circumstances of his disappearance are considered suspicious.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2013000104.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of March 8, 1985, an unidentified male was seen walking on the Miles Hart Bridge. Ten minutes later, one witness returned only to discover a pile of clothing. The clothing was later identified as belonging to Johnson Beardy. It is assumed Johnson took his own life, however his remains have never been recovered. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2011001999.CaseDesc: Abdulatif Salman, age 25, suffers from schizophrenia. He left his home on Twyford Street,  on the evening of October 23, 2010 on foot, with no property, money or identification. He has not been heard from since.

Jacket: Grey, Blue, winter, has a hood

Case reference: 2023037881.CaseDesc: Kristopher Billette was last seen at approximately 7 a.m. on July 14, 2023, on the Buffalo River Dene First Nation, in Saskatchewan. An extensive search of the Buffalo River Dene Nation and along Highway 925 was conducted with no success. Kristopher has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002740.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 1997, Ferdinand Dauz was last seen in New Westminster British Columbia.  Mr. Dauz was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2012020063.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1966, Kimberley Mclean was seen for the last time in Whiteshell Provincial Park in Rennie, Manitoba. That day, Kimberley and her mother had attended Camp Alloway for a staff picnic.  Upon their arrival, Kimberley changed into her bathing suit and went to the dock area. Five minutes later, Kimberley's mother went down to the dock with some cookies for her daughter, but was unable to find her.

Case reference: 2011002399.CaseDesc: Cynthia Sunga was last seen at her family home on Donald street, on or about August 25, 2005.  She was reported missing to the Ottawa Police on November 11, 2005, by a family member.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Molar number 16 Upper missing, removed in 2000. The records of the bordering teeth available.
Tattoo: Lower Back, Tribal heart - Chinese characters for strong

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2021006608.CaseDesc: On July 4,2020, Anna Marquart was last seen by her husband and her sister as she walked away from her residence in Glenboro, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2021008992.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2021, Konstantin Boukhanov travelled to Toronto, Ontario without telling his family. Konstantin has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2023008747.CaseDesc: Joseph Lamartina was last seen on December 16th, 2018 when he checked out of a hotel in Niagara Falls, New York. His abandoned vehicle was located in the parking of the hotel on February 8th, 2019. He has not been heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Chain, With gold Sicilian horn
Gold, Gold, Chain, With St-Christopher medallion

Case reference: 2014004773.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2000, Bassel El Youssef was seen for the last time when he left his mother’s residence in the Saint-Léonard District of Montreal, Quebec. Bassel has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2023025811.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1996 Andrea Robinson was last seen in Niagara Falls, Ontario near Dufferin Island Park. At the time of her disappearance, Andrea was despondent.

Mark: Left Leg, Birth mark 0 lower leg

Case reference: 2015063998.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2015, Erin McGonigal was last seen leaving her home. Erin's home is located in the area of Dundas Street and Cawthra Road, Mississauga, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020132.CaseDesc: François Robillard's family reported his disappearance on July 16, 2010. François' associate, Guy Verdon was also reported missing around the same time.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2021055828.CaseDesc: Penny Yaroshuk was last seen leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on the morning of December 1st, 2021. Penny's vehicle was located abandoned in Hermitage Park, Edmonton, at 12:50 p.m. that same day. Family and friends have not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014005873.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2012, Mark Pearson left his residence in Coaticook, Quebec. Searches have led police to believe that Mr. Pearson could have possibly fallen in the Coaticook River near the intersection of Child and St. Paul East streets in Coaticook, Quebec. He was reported missing on September 7, 2012.

Sweater: Cotton, Blue, T-shirt with Puma on the front

Case reference: 2014003688.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1981, William Earnshaw was hunting in the Clemenceau District, Saskatchewan, southwest of Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. He had separated from two companions and failed to meet at their vehicle in the evening. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate William.

Case reference: 2009002799.CaseDesc: Terry Zubko was a resident of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario and had been a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. Terry left the hospital on July 21, 1982, at 10:00 AM. It is unknown what his diagnosis was at the time, however, reports indicate he suffers from amnesia that requires medication. He was last seen at the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital (which became the Northeast Mental Health Centre, before being torn down in 2013)

Pants: May have been wearing brown corduroy pants or blue jeans
Shirt: May have been wearing a white pullover type shirt

Case reference: 2014006465.CaseDesc: On January 18, 2014, Sofi Ma was seen for the last time with her father, Moses Ma, in Toronto, Ontario.
